text: I can change the name but the slug isn’t editable.

Updating the name will automatically update the slug. For example, if you had <http://www.example.com/blog/tag/example-tag|www.example.com/blog/tag/example-tag> and renamed `example tag` to `the best tag ever` the slug would update to be /blog/tag/the-best-tag-ever
That’s what I’d expect, but in some instances, for example, it’s appending the account organisation name in the slug.
I’ve a feeling it’s something to do with HubSpot creating redirects following tag consolidation.
Do you have any examples (screenshots or preview links?). I would also reach out and submit a support ticket on this as HS would be able to look into this more for you than we could in the community.
Thanks, I’ll get in touch with HS support.
Is it possible to have a choice field in one custom module and then use that choice in another module?
what scenario are you trying to accomplish?
I have three custom modules I am trying to link.
{% if all_widgets[0].params.brand_choice == "MPG" %}
I have a 5 part if statement in two modules that set the header and footer based on brand
the choice is in a third module called Theme Options at the top of the template
I was able to make it work without using the theme options but it is cleaner that way
perhaps if this approach is correct i just have a typo someewhere
Maybe someone else can solve this, I hope
I was able to solve it
thanks!!!
there was a delay between getting everything written and HubSpot recognizing the new modules

I am using FancyBoxApp to load a HubSpot form.  However, on close, the form does not get hidden, it sits at the bottom of the page.  The modal works as expected in the Design Manager preview, but when the template is set up as a Landing Page it does not disappear. Does anyone have any troubleshooting ideas?

Final question for the day :slightly_smiling_face:

Is there a better way to write this in HUBL?
```
{{ '' if string1 in listOfStrings else 'string2' }}
```
I’d like a nice one-liner to output `string2` only if `string1` exists in `listOfStrings`. In my example above (which does work but seems hacky) it’s printing an empty string unless the first condition evaluates truthy.

I was hoping I could do…
```
{{ 'string2' unless string1 in listOfStrings }}
```
…but that doesn’t work.
great!
